abstract: Copper and its alloys are known for their antimicrobial activity, which makes them appealing materials for various touch surfaces in public facilities. These materials are also known for being prone to tarnishing, especially in contact with human palm sweat. The paper describes investigations on tarnishing of copper and various copper alloys by oxidation at elevated temperatures. After evaluation of thickness and chemical composition of oxide layers, microbiological tests were carried out in order to determine the impact of oxidation on antimicrobial efficiency of copper alloys.

author_highlights.sentence: Corrosion products of copper alloys in contact with synthetic human sweat are mostly copper oxides.
Oxidation in elevated temperature was used to produce copper oxide layer with desired thickness.
There is no impact of oxidation of copper alloys on its antimicrobial efficiency.
